intro: Beyrichia ajugoides, commonly known as the African nettle, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its erect, branched stems and opposite, ovate leaves with serrated edges. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers arranged in clusters, which are followed by small, dry fruits. Beyrichia ajugoides is often found in moist, shaded areas and is sometimes used in traditional medicine. Its foliage can cause skin irritation due to the presence of stinging hairs.
